Millbury Jr./Sr. High School Athletic Campus Closure

The following areas will be closed to the public effective Monday, June 1st due to construction related to the renovation of Millbury Jr./Sr. High School’s athletic fields and track:

-All high school campus athletic fields and the running track
-Orchard Street parking lot
-High school front lawn (east side of the school)
-Portions of the parking lot behind the school nearest the construction area

The renovation project will commence June 1st and is scheduled for completion on or before December 2020. During this time period, the areas listed above will be off-limits to all pedestrian traffic, recreational use, or any other purpose not related to the renovation. Motor vehicle traffic behind the school will be reconfigured so as to remain outside of the construction area.

As you know Mrs. Tara Bennett has accepted a position outside of the District and will be leaving us during the holiday break.

Mr. Sean Gilrein will serve as the interim principal for the remainder of the school year. Mr. Gilrein retired from the Dudley-Charlton School District in 2014, where he served as the Superintendent of Schools for 14 years. Prior to that, he was the principal of Shepherd Hill Regional High School for 6 years. In his retirement, he has served as the interim principal of Mashpee Middle-High School and most recently as the interim principal of Tantasqua Regional Junior High School.

Please join us in welcoming Mr. Gilrein to Millbury at the December 19th School Committee meeting, which will begin at 7pm in the Jr./Sr. High School media center.

In addition, Mr. Gilrein will be reaching out to MJSHS families in the coming weeks with opportunities to meet and learn more about him.

Wednesday, May 9, 2018 is National School Nurse Day! We honor more than 95,000 school nurses in the United States who make a difference in the lives of children every day! The theme this year is School Nurses: Advocates for 21st Century Student Health. School nurses lead the way to advance health and support education by ensuring that students are safe, healthy, and ready to learn. Let’s celebrate our school nurses today and always! Learn more at: www.schoolnurseday.org. #SND2018

Physiology of Addiction

Ruth Potee will present on the science behind addiction and what is happening in the brain.

You will hear an overview of how substances and addictive behaviors impact the brain and how the brain is injured by prolonged exposure to these substances and behaviors. This talk focuses on the three predisposing factors that put individuals at risk for addiction: genetics, early exposure during brain development and history of childhood trauma.

ATTENTION Millbury Jr/Sr High Students and Families:
Good evening Millbury families,

Did you know that we will have our very first Unified Sports Track and Field Team? Unified Sports is an entity of Special Olympics, in which students with disabilities are paired with a typical peer to participate in weekly sports practices and competitions with area districts.

Practices will be held Mondays and Tuesdays 2:15-3:30, with meets being held on Thursdays. Our first practice is Monday, March 26th. We are currently looking for students of all abilities to join our team. Thank you,
Jason Avakian, BCBA
